column1: Akim Swedru is a town and the capital of Birim South District
column2: a district in the Eastern Region of south Ghana. Akim Swedru has a 2013 settlement population of 10

column1: Akim Swedru is located around a lot of hills
column2: streams and rivers. There are 2 peak rain seasons during May–June and September–October. The relative humidity ranges from 56% during the dry season and 70% during the rainy season. The town lies within a semi-deciduous rainforest region.
